<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 910, 91]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the refraction of light passing through a transparent block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, using the separate ray-trace sheet provided. You may refer to Fig. 3.1 for guidance.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 144, 794, 768]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 775, 532, 793]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3.1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 804, 146, 822]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 804, 920, 853]]<|/det|>
Place the transparent block, largest face down, on the ray-trace sheet supplied. The block should be approximately in the middle of the paper. Draw the outline of the block **ABCD**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 865, 175, 883]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 865, 920, 899]]<|/det|>
Remove the block and draw a normal **NL** at the centre of side **AB**. Label the point **E** where the normal crosses **AB**. Label the point **M** where the normal crosses **CD**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 170, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(\mathbf{FE}\), to the left of the normal and at an angle of incidence \(i = 30^{\circ}\) to the normal, as shown in Fig. 3.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 171, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 120, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
Place two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) on the line \(\mathbf{FE}\) placing one pin close to point \(\mathbf{E}\). Label the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 166, 170, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 166, 920, 230]]<|/det|>
Replace the block and observe the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) through side \(\mathbf{CD}\) of the block so that the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) appear one behind the other. Place two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) between your eye and the block so that \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\), and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) seen through the block, appear one behind the other. Label the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 243, 170, 262]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 243, 351, 262]]<|/det|>
Remove the block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 275, 170, 293]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 275, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
Draw a line joining the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\). Continue the line until it meets the normal \(\mathbf{NL}\) and label this point \(\mathbf{K}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 291, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 322, 146, 339]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 322, 920, 356]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the angle \(\alpha\) between the line joining the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) and the line \(\mathbf{KL}\).

<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A student is investigating whether the resistance of a wire depends on the material from which the wire is made.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 494, 144]]<|/det|>
Resistance \(R\) is given by the equation \(R = \frac{V}{I}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 163, 539, 181]]<|/det|>
The following apparatus is available to the student:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 235, 210]]<|/det|>
ammeter

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 216, 235, 231]]<|/det|>
voltmeter

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 235, 332, 252]]<|/det|>
power supply (0–3 V)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 256, 364, 272]]<|/det|>
micrometer screw gauge

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 276, 292, 291]]<|/det|>
variable resistor

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 297, 212, 311]]<|/det|>
switch

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 317, 299, 332]]<|/det|>
connecting leads

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 337, 432, 352]]<|/det|>
wires made of different materials.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 367, 920, 400]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate whether the resistance of a wire depends on the material from which the wire is made. You are **not** required to carry out this investigation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 413, 218, 429]]<|/det|>
You should:

<label>*</label>

<label>*</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 476, 920, 508]]<|/det|>
